TopicTitle: Afterimages and weird rendering when landing on Iota looking down (REASON FOUND: Temporal AA, fixed with Scatter v0.0834)

Articles.Content:
My install is being plagued by Iota causing afterimages when pointing the camera from the horizon downwards. My initial thoughts are Scatterer, since it's on an outdated version (0.0772) to be compatible with Galileo's Planet Pack.

Full album: https://imgur.com/a/XorKSKt

Log (not from the session above): https://paste.c-net.org/CoconutsRevved

Edited June 16, 2022 by bigyihsuan

Does it only happen on Iota or are other planets/moons affected too? I don’t think it’s scatterer as Iota doesn’t have an atmosphere as far as I know and scatterer only affects atmospheric bodies. Try updating your graphics card driver?

28 minutes ago, jimmymcgoochie said:

Does it only happen on Iota or are other planets/moons affected too? I don’t think it’s scatterer as Iota doesn’t have an atmosphere as far as I know and scatterer only affects atmospheric bodies. Try updating your graphics card driver?

I haven't gone to any other bodies except Iota in this career save yet. Next chance I get I'll see which bodies have this problem, because I know Gael certainly doesn't.
Disable TUFX and see if it changes. Those screenshots look reminiscent of TUFX motion blur.

15 minutes ago, bigyihsuan said:

I haven't gone to any other bodies except Iota in this career save yet. Next chance I get I'll see which bodies have this problem, because I know Gael certainly doesn't. 

Try a sandbox save and use the cheats to go to different planets and moons, it's a lot faster than doing it in a potentially buggy career game.

16 hours ago, jimmymcgoochie said:

Does it only happen on Iota or are other planets/moons affected too? I don’t think it’s scatterer as Iota doesn’t have an atmosphere as far as I know and scatterer only affects atmospheric bodies. Try updating your graphics card driver?

Finally been able to get on, disabled TUFX. This is happening on Ceti as well. What's also weird is that you can see where the Waterfall plumes are re-drawing areas of the screen.

EDIT: Log from this session: https://paste.c-net.org/CoconutsRevved

Full Album: https://imgur.com/a/kYktwqa

Edited May 8, 2022 by bigyihsuan

Status update: uninstalled Scatterer, and the issue seems to be gone.

Now to test with properly-versioned Scatterer configs...
in scatterer configs, see if you have temporal anti-aliasing enabled, and disable that.

On 5/9/2022 at 2:38 PM, Rodger said:

in scatterer configs, see if you have temporal anti-aliasing enabled, and disable that.

The issue was temporal AA. Turning it off fixed it. Thanks!

Unfortunate double (triple?) post, but some news

It seems this issue was fixed in a more recent version of Scatter (since version 0.0834) that GPP is not compatible with (GPP wants 0.0772).

So if you don't use GPP, this bug shouldn't exist, it seems.

On 5/10/2022 at 8:04 PM, bigyihsuan said:

The issue was temporal AA.

18 hours ago, bigyihsuan said:

It seems this issue was fixed in a more recent version of Scatter (since version 0.0834) that GPP is not compatible with (GPP wants 0.0772).

So if you don't use GPP, this bug shouldn't exist, it seems.

It's not just GPP. Many packs (including my favorites JNSQ and KSRSS) still require Scatterer v0.07xx and they default to Temporal AA. Going into the alt-f11  Scatterer settings to change from Temporal AA to SMAA is an important step for new KSP playthroughs.
Oh my god you absolute madlads, I was having the same exact issue with my own install but instead with KSRSS. You have saved me so much headache and trouble. Thank you!
